title: Fluzone High-Dose Side Effects: Common, Severe, Long Term
description: Learn about the side effects of Fluzone High-Dose (influenza virus vaccine, inactivated), from common to rare, for consumers and healthcare professionals.
cleaned_text: inactivated [Medically reviewed](/support/editorial_policy.html#editorial-staff) by Drugs.com. Last updated on Aug 7, 2023. Note: This document contains side effect information about influenza virus vaccine, inactivated. Some dosage forms listed on this page may not apply to the brand name Fluzone High-Dose. Applies to [influenza virus vaccine, inactivated](/mtm/influenza-virus-vaccine-injection.html): intramuscular dosage forms: Serious side effects of Fluzone High-Dose Along with its needed effects, [influenza](/cg/influenza.html) virus vaccine, inactivated (the active ingredient contained in [Fluzone High-Dose](/cdi/fluzone-high-dose.html)) may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention. Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur while taking influenza virus vaccine, inactivated: Less common [Fever](/health-guide/fever.html)or chills Incidence not known - Black, tarry stools - bleeding gums - blood in the urine or stools [cough](/cg/chronic-cough.html) [difficulty swallowing](/cg/dysphagia.html) - dizziness [fainting](/cg/syncope.html) [fast heartbeat](/cg/tachycardia.html) - hives, [itching](/cg/itchy-skin.html), or [rash](/health-guide/rash.html) - inability to move the arms and legs - large, hive-like swelling on the face, eyelids, lips, tongue, throat, hands, legs, feet, or sex organs - pinpoint red spots on the skin - puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue - sudden numbness and weakness in the arms and legs - tightness in the chest - unusual bleeding or bruising - unusual tiredness or weakness Other side effects of Fluzone High-Dose Some side effects of influenza virus vaccine, inactivated may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them: More common [Headache](/cg/tension-headache.html) - joint or [muscle pain](/cg/acl-injury.html) - pain at the injection site Less common For Healthcare Professionals Applies to influenza virus vaccine, inactivated: intradermal suspension, intramuscular solution, intramuscular suspension, nasal spray. General The most common adverse events were local reactions, [myalgia](/cg/acl-injury.html), and headache.[ [Ref](#refs)] Local Very site injection sterile abscess[ [Ref](#refs)] Other Very common (10% or more): Crying malaise (38%), fever (16%) Common (1% to 10%): facial or cranial nerve paralysis, limb paralysis, confusion, paralysis (including Bell's Palsy), [vertigo](/cg/dizziness.html), exacerbation congestion (58%), cough (15%), upper respiratory tract infection (13%) Common (1% 10%): (13%) Postmarketing reports: [Dysphagia](/cg/dysphagia.html), of mouth, and/or tongue[ [Ref](#refs)] Metabolic Very common (10% or more): Loss of (33.3%), decreased appetite Dysmenorrhea[ [Ref](#refs)] Frequently asked questions [What flu vaccine can I use with an egg allergy?](/medical-answers/what-flu-vaccine-have-egg-allergy-3574109/) [How and where is a flu shot injection given?](/medical-answers/flu-shot-injection-3564159/) [How can I get a flu vaccine without a needle?](/medical-answers/how-flu-vaccine-without-needle-3574396/) [How well does the flu vaccine work?](/medical-answers/how-flu-vaccine-work-3574106/) [Where can I get the flu vaccine right now?](/medical-answers/where-flu-vaccine-right-3574107/) More about Fluzone [... +16 more](#) formulations Related treatment guides References 1. Further information Always consult your healthcare provider to ensure the information displayed on this page applies to your personal circumstances. Some side effects may not be reported.
